etymologies: late 17th century: from tri-‘three’ + Latin cuspis, cuspid- ‘cusp’

definitions: denoting a tooth with three cusps or points.
shortDefinitions: denoting tooth with three cusps or points

definitions: denoting or relating to a valve formed of three triangular segments, particularly that between the right atrium and ventricle of the heart
shortDefinitions: denoting or relating to valve formed of three triangular segments, particularly that between right atrium and ventricle of heart
